page.title: 18LOCAL FARMING 1.
page.content: Farming in the area revolves around a number of well established farms, many privately owned and held by families for well over 50 years. There are no large estate farms or vast prairie fields. The farms are very much family concerns with whole families including young and adult children very much involved in the running of the farm. Most farms are handed from father to son and this pattern is very much supported for the future. Noticeably few people are employed on the farms other than the family even at peak busy times. When the farm is actually owned, the owners appear to often rent extra land to farm. Most of the farmers buy and sell at the local market in Leighton Buzzard on a Tuesday, or at the larger Banbury market. Only one farmer indicated that he contracted the marketing job out.
